pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:2.1: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:5.1: 26. The training rule on robes for a group
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:6.2: At that time a family that was supporting the nun Thullanandā said to her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:6.3: “Venerable, we’re going to give a robe-cloth to the Order of nuns.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:6.5: “You are very busy.” And she created an obstacle for them.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:6.6: Soon afterwards the house of that family burned down.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:6.7: They then complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:6.8: “How can Venerable Thullanandā create an obstacle for our gift?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:6.9: We are now without both possessions and merit.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:7.1: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:7.2: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:7.3: “How can Venerable Thullanandā create an obstacle for a group to obtain robe-cloth?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:7.7: How can the nun Thullanandā create an obstacle for a group to obtain robe-cloth?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:7.9: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:8.1: ‘If a nun creates an obstacle for a group to obtain a robe-cloth, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:10.2: the Order of nuns is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:11.2: one of the six kinds of robe-cloth, but not smaller than what can be transferred.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:12.2: if she creates an obstacle, thinking, “What can be done so that these people don’t give robe-cloth?”, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:12.3: If she creates an obstacle for another requisite, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:12.4: If she creates an obstacle for a number of nuns or a single nun or someone who is not fully ordained to obtain robe-cloth or another requisite, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:13.2: if she obstructs them after showing them a benefit;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:13.4: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc26:14.1: The sixth training rule is finished.
